title: Provisions on the Administration of Internet Information Service Algorithmic Recommendations
content:
# China's CAC Algorithm Regulations (2022)

## Official Title
Provisions on the Administration of Internet Information Service Algorithmic Recommendations (《互联网信息服务算法推荐管理规定》)

## Effective Date
March 1, 2022

## Issuing Authority
Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC)

## Key Provisions

### 1. Scope
Applies to any internet service using algorithms to match or push information to users based on:
- User preferences
- User behavior
- User location
Includes news apps, social media, e-commerce platforms (Douyin/TikTok, Taobao, etc.)

### 2. Filing and Security Assessments
- Providers must file algorithms with CAC within 30 days of deployment
- Algorithms impacting public opinion, sector planning, or user rights require CAC security assessment before launch
- Annual self-assessments and filings required
- Changes to algorithms trigger re-filing

### 3. Prohibited Practices
- No algorithms promoting illegal content (subversion, terrorism, pornography, violence)
- Cannot manipulate public opinion or incite unrest
- No discrimination based on politics, religion, ethnicity
- Ban on "addictive" designs (infinite scrolling without user consent)
- No ecological harm (e.g., illegal wildlife trade promotion)
- No price discrimination via algorithms

### 4. User Protections
- Mandatory "opt-out" buttons for personalized recommendations
- Chronological/non-recommended feed option available
- Disclose algorithmic logic upon user request
- Label AI-generated content (deepfakes)
- Provide editing/deletion tools

### 5. Platform Responsibilities
- Real-time monitoring and logging (minimum 3 months retention)
- Quick fixes for violations
- Report incidents to CAC within 24 hours
- Fines up to ¥1 million (~$140K USD) for non-compliance
- Possible service suspension

## 2023 Expansion: Deep Synthesis Measures
August 2022: CAC issued draft Measures for Generative AI
Finalized 2023: Additional requirements for AI-generated content regulation

## Implementation Evidence
- 300+ algorithms filed from ByteDance, Alibaba, Tencent in early 2022
- ByteDance implemented "不推荐" (Not Recommended) button
- Douyin Youth Mode: 40 mins/day max
- Platform compliance audits conducted 2022-2023

## Comparison to Global Regulations
CAC rules are among world's strictest:
- More prescriptive than EU DSA (Digital Services Act)
- Far more mandatory than US (no federal algorithm law)
- Stronger enforcement than India's IT Rules 2021
- Prioritizes social stability over privacy alone
